reason: The reduction from Tr[rho_AB * D_log(1_A ⊗ rho_B)[1_A ⊗ delta_B]] to Tr[rho_B delta_B rho_B^{-1}] involves two unstated intermediate steps: (1) the tensor-product compatibility D_log(1_A ⊗ rho_B)[1_A ⊗ delta_B] = 1_A ⊗ D_log(rho_B)[delta_B], and (2) the partial trace identity Tr[rho_AB (1_A ⊗ X_B)] = Tr_B[rho_B X_B]. Only after these reductions is it the case that A = B = rho_B in the Fréchet derivative identity Tr[A D_log(A)[C]] = Tr[C], which justifies writing Tr[rho_B delta_B rho_B^{-1}]. Without these steps the claim implicitly uses Tr[X D_log(Y)[Z]] = Tr[Y^{-1} X Z] for X ≠ Y, which is false in general. The final answer is correct but the exposition should make the reduction explicit.
